alert.note: Alert for Grainger (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 24 at 8:19AM CST until February 24 at 2:15PM CST by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1230 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east Tennessee, including the following counties, Grainger, Greene, Hamblen and Hawkins. * WHEN...Until 1230 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 919 AM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen over the last 3 hours. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 1.5 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Morristown, Rogersville, Rutledge, Bean Station, Russellville, Mosheim, Blaine, Bulls Gap, Baileyton, St. Clair, Mooresburg, Mohawk, McCloud, Romeo, Alpha, Panther Creek State Park, Kepler, Jearoldstown, Buffalo Springs and Joppa. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
